sentences.en: "It's my ulcer," he added by way of explanation.
sentences.cn: “那是因为我得了溃疡，”他补充解释说。

sentences.en: A bacterium is identified as the cause for his duodenal ulcer.
sentences.cn: 一种细菌被断定为造成他十二指肠溃疡的根源.

sentences.en: Aspirin can ulcer the stomach lining.
sentences.cn: 阿司匹林能造成胃壁溃。

sentences.en: Gastritis may cause symptoms resembling those of peptic ulcer.
sentences.cn: 胃炎可引起类似消化性溃疡的症状.

sentences.en: He eats only bland food because of his ulcer.
sentences.cn: 他患溃疡,只能吃无刺激性的食物.

sentences.en: He had walked several kilometres over pavements, and his varicose ulcer was throbbing.
sentences.cn: 他在人行道上走了好几公里, 静脉曲张的地方又开始刺痒.

sentences.en: He has been operated on for his duoedenal ulcer.
sentences.cn: 他已因十二指肠溃疡而作了手术.

sentences.en: Peptic ulcer is a sharply circumscribed loss of tissue.
sentences.cn: 消化性溃疡是一种界限清楚的组织损毁.

sentences.en: She had an ulcer in her mouth.
The ulcer had been troubling her for several years.
sentences.cn: 溃疡已经折磨她好几年了。

sentences.en: The ulcer has perforated into the lessor omental bursa.
They had dressed his varicose ulcer with soothing ointment.
sentences.cn: 他们在静脉曲张的疮口上抹了清凉的油膏.

sentences.en: Winston reached down and cautiously scratched his varicose ulcer.
sentences.cn: 温斯顿把手伸下去,小心翼翼地搔他的脚脖子.

words.tran_cn: 溃疡；[病理] 溃疡形成
溃烂（ulcerate的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: a sore area on your skin or inside your body that may bleed or produce poisonous substances
